sn43.12:4.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the unconditioned and the path that leads to the unconditioned.
sn43.12:4.4: The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn43.12:4.6: And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?
sn43.12:4.8: This is called the path that leads to the unconditioned.
sn43.12:4.9: So, mendicants, I’ve taught you the unconditioned and the path that leads to the unconditioned.
sn43.12:4.10: Out of compassion, I’ve done what a teacher should do for the benefit of their disciples.
sn43.12:4.11: Here are these roots of trees, and here are these empty huts.
sn43.12:4.12: Practice absorption, mendicants! Don’t be negligent! Don’t regret it later!
sn43.12:4.14: This is my instruction to you.”

sn43.12:6.1: “And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?
sn43.12:6.2: Samādhi with placing the mind and keeping it connected. …
sn43.12:6.5: Samādhi without placing the mind, but just keeping it connected. …
sn43.12:6.8: Samādhi without placing the mind or keeping it connected. …
sn43.12:8.2: A mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world. …
sn43.12:8.5: A mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn43.12:8.8: A monastic meditates by observing an aspect of the mind …
sn43.12:8.11: A monastic meditates by observing an aspect of principles …
sn43.12:9.2: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and endeavors so that bad, unwholesome qualities don’t arise. …
sn43.12:9.5: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and endeavors so that bad, unwholesome qualities are given up. …
sn43.12:9.8: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and endeavors so that wholesome qualities arise. …
sn43.12:9.11: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and endeavors so that wholesome qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are fulfilled by development.
sn43.12:10.2: A mendicant develops the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to enthusiasm, and active endeavor. …
sn43.12:10.5: A mendicant develops the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to energy …
sn43.12:10.11: samādhi due to inquiry, and active endeavor. …
sn43.12:11.2: A mendicant develops the faculty of faith, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. …
sn43.12:11.5: A mendicant develops the faculty of energy …
sn43.12:11.14: wisdom, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. …
sn43.12:12.2: A mendicant develops the power of faith …
sn43.12:12.14: wisdom, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. …
sn43.12:13.2: A mendicant develops the awakening factor of mindfulness …
sn43.12:13.10: equanimity, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn43.12:14.15: right samādhi, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
